definition: lit. to jump out of a fire pit (idiom); to escape from a living hell/to free oneself from a life of torture
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
variant of 坑[keng1]/pit/hole
hole/pit/tunnel/to defraud
to escape from the abyss of suffering/to shed off a wretched plight
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
ideal husband/"Mr. Right"
lit. sea of bitterness/abyss of worldly suffering (Buddhist term)/depths of misery
to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
to attempt suicide/to court death
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
lit. to rest and fly together (idiom)/fig. to live in each other's pockets/to be inseparable
to stay at home while one's husband is away/grass widow
to commit suicide
to get married (of woman)
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to prostitute oneself/to sell oneself into slavery
hard lot/bitter fate/unfortunate
